resource.chars:
31 
Diphydae throws light upon the matter - the detached 
free-swimming testis or ovary of Sphenia [text?] has 
just as much claim to a distinct generic name as 
has <u>Sthenyo<\u> or <u>Cladonema<\u> and yet in what respect does this differ from the persistent ovary of <u>Eudoxia<\u> 
which surely is an organ and nothing but an organ? 
Would it not be as reasonable to give a distinct 
name to Needham's sperm-sacs because they 
exhibit certain independent motions external to 
the body of the Cephalopod? 
The point is of consequence, because it is anything 
but desirable that <u>true polypes<\u> with <u>medusiform<\u> 
generative organs should be confounded with the <u>Polypiform 
larvae<\u> of true <u>Medusae<\u>
